core

Class AbstractMultiProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AbstractComponent
      • core.AbstractProblem
        • core.AbstractMultiProblem

  • public abstract class AbstractMultiProblem
extends AbstractProblem
    Provides a general interface to formulate own problems that evaluates multiple representations at a time.

    In order to provide a visualized evaluation the method AbstractSingleProblem.replayWithVisualization(core.AbstractRepresentation) must be overwritten.

    To support requirement changes based on different parameters override the following method:

    -AbstractProblem.adjustRequirements(java.util.Hashtable, java.util.Hashtable)

    Author:
    Istvan Fehervari

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractMultiProblem.RepresentationWithScore
      A structure that contains a representation along with its score.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateFitness

        public abstract java.util.List<AbstractMultiProblem.RepresentationWithScore> evaluateFitness(AbstractRepresentation[] candidates)
        Returns the fitness of the given representations. The returned list contains the representations with their achieved scores. A higher score usually means a better ranking.
        However, the order of the candidates matters the most for ranking, the scores are secondary.
        Parameters:
        candidates - Array of candidates to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        a list of evaluated candidates with decreasing fitness. That means better candidates have lower index.

      • replayWithVisualization

        public void replayWithVisualization(AbstractRepresentation[] candidates)
        This function is called when the user request a visual replay from the problem. A total re-evaluation is not needed, only to provide a visual mean for the user to grasp the performance of the indicated candidate solutions.

        It is recommended to use advanced threading for display like SwingWorker.

        Parameters:
        candidates - Array of candidates whose replay has been requested.
